description: Celebrate the Open House Festival with this fun and interactive walking tour about Britain's forgotten history of the Black Tudors. Learn how African and European alliances, wars and conquests shaped the journeys of four Black Tudors.

events.name: The Mysterious Black Tudors Southwark Riverside Walking

factsheet.heading: About the riverside walking tour
paragraphs: Celebrate the Open House Festival with this fun and interactive riverside walking tour about Britain's forgotten history of the Black Tudors through the lens of the River Thames. We will look at how Tudor alliances, wars and conquests shaped the lives of four Black Tudors.
*WE MEET OUTSIDE THE REMAINS OF WINCHESTER PALACE*

Winchester Palace, Pickfords Wharf, London SE1 9DN
Located on  road opposite the Golden Hinde.

factsheet.heading: Who is the event suitable for?
paragraphs: Suitable for adults, teenagers and parents/guardians with children aged 7+, but all ages are welcome!

factsheet.heading: What Do I Need To Bring?
paragraphs: The event involves short walk from Winchester Palace to Tower Bridge. It is advised that you wear comfortable shoes and clothing.
We will provide children with activity packs and pens/pencils to complete. There are prizes for the Tudor sleuths too.

travel_info: Train: Cannon Street, Blackfriars, Waterloo, London Bridge

name: The Mysterious Black Tudors - Riverside Walking Tour
